elements.name: question1
rows: You can only search for payments and credit notes in e-banking, but you cannot download any account data.
eBills are electronic bills that SBB, for example, sends directly to our e-banking system for the monthly travelcard. You can approve the payment with just a few clicks.
Two-factor authentication means that you should always write down your password on a notepad so that you can log in at any time.
You can buy securities (e.g. a share in a company) in online banking or e-banking.
You can take out mortgages with all banks in e-banking (e.g. to buy a house).
Most banks allow you to view and, if necessary, extend your mortgage.
You cannot make international payments with e-banking.
With the e-banking app, you can only view payments, but not initiate them.
Under "Country settings" for debit cards, you can set where you want to allow payments abroad (to protect against unauthorized access, other countries cannot be enabled).
If you want to buy an American or European share, you can do so via e-banking.
